children.name: Example
children.text: var DevOpsOrchestrationCustomToolIntegrationHandler = Class.create(); DevOpsOrchestrationCustomToolIntegrationHandler.prototype = { handleTool: function(toolName) { if (!gs.nil(toolName) && toolName == 'sn_devops_custom_tool') return true; return false; }, getNativeIdForOrchestrationTask: function(payload) { return payload.orchestrationTaskName; }, type: 'DevOpsOrchestrationCustomToolIntegrationHandler' };
children.text2: In this , a script include named DevOpsOrchestrationCustomToolIntegrationHandler implements the methods handleTool and getNativeIdForOrchestrationTask. The getNativeIdForOrchestrationTask method is implemented to return the value of the orchestrationTaskName parameter from the payload for POST /devops/tool/{capability}.

children.name: String
children.text: Value of the orchestrationTaskName parameter from the payload.

children.name: payload
children.text2: Payload containing data from the custom tool accepted by POST /devops/tool/{capability}, where capability is orchestration.

children.name: getNativeIdForOrchestrationTask(Object payload)
children.text: Returns the value of the orchestrationTaskName parameter from the payload for POST /devops/tool/{capability}.
children.text2: You must implement this method in a script include before calling DevOps - POST /devops/tool/{capability}.

children.name: Example
children.text: var DevOpsOrchestrationCustomToolIntegrationHandler = Class.create(); DevOpsOrchestrationCustomToolIntegrationHandler.prototype = { handleTool: function(toolName) { if (!gs.nil(toolName) && toolName == 'sn_devops_custom_tool') return true; return false; }, getNativeIdForOrchestrationTask: function(payload) { return payload.orchestrationTaskName; }, type: 'DevOpsOrchestrationCustomToolIntegrationHandler' };
children.text2: In this , a script include named DevOpsOrchestrationCustomToolIntegrationHandler implements the methods handleTool and getNativeIdForOrchestrationTask. The handleTool method is implemented to check that the passed in name is for the correct tool. Replace 'sn_devops_custom_tool' with the name of the tool that you're using.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether this handler is valid for the specified tool.

Possible values:
  • true: This handler can be used for the specified tool.
  • false: This handler can't be used for the specified tool.

children.name: toolName
children.text2: Name of the tool. Located in the Tool Name field in the DevOps Tool Integration [sn_devops_tool_integration] table.

children.name: handleTool(String toolName)
children.text: Checks if this handler is valid for the specified tool.
children.text2: You must implement this method in a script include before calling DevOps - POST /devops/tool/{capability}.

name: DevOpsOrchestrationToolIntegrationHandler
text: The DevOpsOrchestrationToolIntegrationHandler API enables processing of payloads from custom DevOps tools.
text2:
A custom DevOps tool is any tool that doesn't have an integration with DevOps. See Setting up DevOps tools for a list of tools that have DevOps integrations.

Use this API with DevOps - POST /devops/tool/{capability}. This API enables the processing of payloads that are used by POST /devops/tool/{capability}. You must implement the methods from this API in a script include before calling POST /devops/tool/{capability}.

This API is provided within the sn_devops namespace. For more information about DevOps, see DevOps.
